Detailed Description

A ChunkedAllocator maintains a list of memory chunks from which it allocates memory in response to Allocate() calls; Chunks stay around for the lifetime of the allocator or until they are passed on to another allocator.

An Allocate() call will attempt to allocate memory from the chunk that was most recently added; if that chunk doesn't have enough memory to satisfy the allocation request, the free chunks are searched for one that is big enough otherwise a new chunk is added to the list. The current_chunk_idx_ always points to the last chunk with allocated memory. In order to keep allocation overhead low, chunk sizes double with each new one added, until they hit a maximum size. Example: ChunkedAllocator* p = new ChunkedAllocator(); for (int i = 0; i < 1024; ++i) { returns 8-byte aligned memory (effectively 24 bytes): .. = p->Allocate(17); } at this point, 17K have been handed out in response to Allocate() calls and 28K of chunks have been allocated (chunk sizes: 4K, 8K, 16K) We track total and peak allocated bytes. At this point they would be the same: 28k bytes. A call to Clear will return the allocated memory so total_allocate_bytes_ becomes 0 while peak_allocate_bytes_ remains at 28k. p->Clear(); the entire 1st chunk is returned: .. = p->Allocate(4 * 1024); 4K of the 2nd chunk are returned: .. = p->Allocate(4 * 1024); a new 20K chunk is created .. = p->Allocate(20 * 1024); ChunkedAllocator* p2 = new ChunkedAllocator(); the new ChunkedAllocator receives all chunks containing data from p p2->AcquireData(p, false); At this point p.total_allocated_bytes_ would be 0 while p.peak_allocated_bytes_ remains unchanged. The one remaining (empty) chunk is released: delete p;

Member Function Documentation

◆ AcquireData()

void parquet::ChunkedAllocator::AcquireData ( ChunkedAllocator *  src,
bool  keep_current 
)

Absorb all chunks that hold data from src.

If keep_current is true, let src hold on to its last allocated chunk that contains data. All offsets handed out by calls to GetCurrentOffset() for 'src' become invalid.

◆ Allocate()

uint8_t* parquet::ChunkedAllocator::Allocate ( int  size)

Allocates 8-byte aligned section of memory of 'size' bytes at the end of the the current chunk.

Creates a new chunk if there aren't any chunks with enough capacity.

◆ Clear()

void parquet::ChunkedAllocator::Clear ( )

Makes all allocated chunks available for re-use, but doesn't delete any chunks.

◆ FreeAll()

void parquet::ChunkedAllocator::FreeAll ( )

Deletes all allocated chunks.

FreeAll() or AcquireData() must be called for each mem pool

◆ ReturnPartialAllocation()

void parquet::ChunkedAllocator::ReturnPartialAllocation ( int  byte_size)

Returns 'byte_size' to the current chunk back to the mem pool.

This can only be used to return either all or part of the previous allocation returned by Allocate().
